content:
Nam Duong

(Vietnamese: Duong Le Nam; Dương Lê Nam)

Education

  • Ph.D, Computer Science, February 2014
    • University of California, Irvine (UCI)
    • Advisor: Professor Alexander V. Veidenbaum
  • M.Sc, Electrical and Computer Engineering, December 2008
    • University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign (UIUC)
  • B.Sc, Electronics and Telecommunications, June 2004
    • Hanoi University of Science and Technology (HUST), Hanoi, Vietnam
    • Graduated with honors, ranked 1st among 443 students of the School of Electronics and Telecommunications

Research interests

  • Next generation high performance and low power microprocessors, spanning single-core and multi-core architectures.
  • Current emphasis is design and management of cache hierarchy and memory subsystem .

Publications

Conferences, Journals, Workshops

  • Nam Duong, Dali Zhao, Taesu Kim, Rosario Cammarota, Mateo Valero and Alexander V. Veidenbaum. Improving cache management policies using dynamic reuse distances. Proceedings of the 45th Annual IEEE/ACM International Symposium on Microarchitecture (MICRO), December 2012 (pdf).
  • Nam Duong, Taesu Kim, Dali Zhao, and Alexander V. Veidenbaum. Revisiting level-0 caches in embedded processors. Proceedings of the International Conference on Compilers, Architecture and Synthesis for Embedded Systems (CASES), October 2012 (pdf).
  • Nam Duong and Alexander V. Veidenbaum. Compiler-assisted, selective out-of-order commit. IEEE Computer Architecture Letters (CAL), May 2012 (pdf).
  • Nam Duong, Rosario Cammarota, Dali Zhao, Taesu Kim, and Alexander V. Veidenbaum. SCORE: A score-based memory cache replacement policy. The 1st JILP Workshop on Computer Architecture Competitions (JWAC), June 2010.
  • Nam Duong and Rakesh Kumar. Register multimapping: A technique for reducing register bank conflicts in processors with large register files. Proceedings of the IEEE Symposium on Application Specific Processors (SASP), July 2009.

Technical reports

  • Nam Duong and Alexander V. Veidenbaum. Compiler assisted out-of-order instruction commit. CECS Technical Report 10-11, November 2010.
  • Nam Duong and Rakesh Kumar. Register multimapping: reducing register bank conflicts through one-to-many logical-to-physical register mapping. Technical Report CRHC-08-07, 2008.

Contact information

  • Address: 3091 Donald Bren Hall, Irvine, CA 92697, USA
  • Email: nlduong at ics dot uci dot edu
